intro: Hieracium tauschii subsp. xanthothyrsum, commonly known as the yellow thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in poor soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
